lead_paragraph: BOROWITZ--Rabbi Eugene Bernard, a teacher of generations of rabbis and Jewish leaders, adoring and devoted husband, father, grandfather and great-grandfather, professor of modern Jewish thought and education at the Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion, scholar and author of 19 books and innumerable articles over seven decades, founder of Sh'ma Magazine, and proclaimed "bearer of light" by the Union of Reform Judaism passed away peacefully in his home on January 22, 2016. He was predeceased by his beloved wife Estelle Covel Borowitz and is survived by his children Lisa Borowitz, Drucy Borowitz and Philip Glick, and Nan and Andrew Langowitz; their children Zoey Glick and Matthew Swerdlin, Zachary Glick, Noah Langowitz and Monikah Schuschu, Emily Langowitz, and Joshua Langowitz; and great-grandson Lewis Swerdlin. He was a chaplain in the U.S. Navy and served congregations in St. Louis, MO and Port Washington, NY. Funeral service at 1pm on Sunday, January 24, Temple Sinai, 458 Lakeside Drive, Stamford, CT with burial to follow. Shiva Sunday, January 24, 6-8pm with 7pm service and again Monday, January 25, 2-4pm at Hyatt Regency Greenwich, Greenwich, CT. Presidential Suite. Further shiva at the home of Lisa Borowitz, 177 East Hartsdale Ave, Apt 5S, Hartsdale, NY, Monday evening, January 25 from 7-9pm with a service at 7:30; Tuesday, January 26 from 2-4pm and again 7-9pm with a service at 7:30pm. 1/3
